conclusion: Consider forces acting on objects and laws of physics to determine outcome.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
According to physics, objects continue in initial motion direction unless acted upon by external force.
Objects C, D, E, and F are stationary.
Stationary objects will not be affected by movement of other objects.
Objects experience gravitational force due to Earth's pull, falling towards Earth's center.
Objects A and B will continue to move downwards until they reach the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
